abstract: The Shanghai composite index gained 1.7 percent on Thursday and the Shenzhen index rose 3.1 percent.
snippet: The Shanghai composite index gained 1.7 percent on Thursday and the Shenzhen index rose 3.1 percent.
lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — Stocks in China rallied on Thursday, helped by the country’s newly announced decision to open its markets to more foreign investment and expectations that Beijing might soon take additional steps to bolster flagging economic growth.

headline.main: Indexes Up as China Acts to Lure Foreign Investors
headline.print_headline: Indexes Up as China Acts To Lure Foreign Investors
